text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

About 10 years
ago, I was hitting

a ceiling both personally
and professionally.

And I taught myself everything
I could possibly learn on my own

about biostatistics and had
the chance to practice it
in the real world.

But when it came to getting
a job as a biostatistician,

it was difficult
because I didn't
have PhD at the end of my name.

So I started looking
at online statistics

programs that could give me some
of the credibility, to what I'd

been working toward in my
career in the last 10 years.

The Stanford Med Stats
Program not only fit the bill

but it didn't break
the bank either.
And so it was a no-brainer.
It was in 2022.

February was my last
class in Med Stats III.

And in March I was
applying for jobs.

Was able to within three months
of that land this current one.

So I don't think
I would have had

the confidence and the
additional skill set

necessary to land this job
without the Med Stats Program.

I still have a giant binder
of all of the homework
and notes that I took.
And I look at it regularly.

And I think that's a testament
to how good the program is.

I leveraged those in
my day to day tasks.

I was burning the
candle at both ends.
My family life was suffering.

I wasn't as present for
my kids as I wanted to be.

And it was serendipitous, that
I was able to find the Stanford
Med Stats Program.

And gain the important
and necessary skills

to be a biostatistician
in a real world setting,

at a hospital that allowed
me to work remotely.

And to be able to do
what I love and walk
my kids to school every day.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
